title: Double line face
content:
Please could you help me identify this one ![HA](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142034im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23858.gif)   
   
What is the name given to founts like this?
author: jonathanlawley

comments.content:
Looks like PL Torino Outline, except the weight of the strokes look a bit different.   
   
 [http://www.fonts.com/fontlist/205140-torino-outline.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142034/http:/www.fonts.com/fontlist/205140-torino-outline.html)
the M and the general width don't seen similar

You asked what name is given to fonts like this, and there seems to be no uniformity in naming (again). I have seen them called Handtooled, Engraved, Shaded, Open, Inline and Outline. These same terms can describe different forms of open styles, with uniform strokes or uneven ones, like this sample.
